Pystmark¶

Pystmark is a wrapper around the Postmark API. It is built on top of Python Requests.

Installation¶

Install the extension with one of the following commands:

$ easy_install pystmark

or alternatively if you have pip installed:

$ pip install pystmark

Usage¶

Ensure that Python Requests is installed.

API¶

Sender¶

class pystmark.PystSender(message=None, api_key=None, secure=True, test=False, **request_args)¶

A wrapper for the Postmark API.

All of the arguments used in constructing this object are used as defaults in the final call to Pystmark.send(). You can override any of them at that time.

Parameters:
  • message (dict) – Default message data
  • api_key – Your Postmark API key.
  • secure – Use the https scheme for Postmark API
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API
  • **request_args – Passed to requests.post()
send(message=None, api_key=None, test=None, secure=None, **request_args)¶

Send request to Postmark API. Returns result of requests.post().

Parameters:
  • message (dict) – Your Postmark message data.
  • api_key (str) – Your Postmark API key.
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API.
  • secure’ – Use the https Postmark API.
  • **request_args – Extra arguments to pass to requests.post()
Return type:

requests.Response

Batch Sender¶

class pystmark.PystBatchSender(message=None, api_key=None, secure=True, test=False, **request_args)¶

A wrapper for the Postmark Batch API.

All of the arguments used in constructing this object are used as defaults in the final call to Pystmark.send(). You can override any of them at that time.

Parameters:
  • message (dict) – Default message data
  • api_key – Your Postmark API key.
  • secure – Use the https scheme for Postmark API
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API
  • **request_args – Passed to requests.post()
send(message=None, api_key=None, test=None, secure=None, **request_args)¶

Send batch request to Postmark API. Returns result of requests.post().

Parameters:
  • message (A collection of Postmark message data) – Your Postmark message data.
  • api_key (str) – Your Postmark API key.
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API.
  • secure’ – Use the https Postmark API.
  • **request_args – Extra arguments to pass to requests.post()
Return type:

requests.Response
